definition[0]: in a takeover, the price offered by the buyer for existing shareholders’ shares, or the total value of all the shares at this price
example[0]: Hutchinson’s offer price values Cavendish at about HK$11.8 billion.
definition[1]: the price at which a share, bond etc is offered for sale
example[1]: $300 million of 7½% eurobonds due Feb. 27,2007 at an initially fixed offer price of 98.91
definition[2]: the price of shares when they are bought and sold for the first time
